title: OgNasty
author: OgNasty
created_time: January 21, 2023, 08:56:01 PMLast edit: April 24, 2024, 05:38:26 PM by OgNasty
content: Anyone interested in purchasing an S17 Pro?  Feel free to reach out to me via PM with an offer.  I'm shipping from in the US, so I'd like to keep to shipping in the continental US.  Some details about the machine...  It was just returned from a repair facility with documentation that it has been tested and is working.  It ships without the cables, so you will need those.  I'm looking to accept Bitcoin and can ship the same day if you so desire.  We can use escrow if you pay for it, or you can pay first and I can ship (check my trading history).  Let me know if you have any other questions.

comments.author: jimjam123
comments.body: How much you looking for shipped to the NorthEast?Thanks,

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: jimjam123 on January 21, 2023, 11:51:40 PMHow much you looking for shipped to the NorthEast?Thanks,If I am going to throw out a number, 0.035 BTC seems like a nice clean asking price.    Feel free to PM me with an offer if you would like.  I'm not sure exactly what shipping would cost for this thing, it's pretty heavy, but I'm open to receiving a shipping label and letting you select the shipping method/process as well.  Let me know if you need pictures or any further information about the miner.  I'm happy to sell it and I think now that BTC is rising in price, ASIC miners are about to see a little boom in price, but maybe I'm wrong.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.created_time: January 30, 2023, 08:37:04 PMLast edit: January 31, 2023, 11:59:21 PM by OgNasty
comments.body: Still looking for offers.  Maybe a 0.03 BTC price or something in that ballpark depending on shipping arrangements...  Feel free to shoot me an offer.  Haven't found one I like well enough to accept yet.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Lowering my asking price again to 0.025 BTC plus shipping.  I've only received a couple of offers so far.  It seems like there's a lull currently in the mining business.  I might have to turn to a traditional marketplace to sell this or unpack it and get it mining again.  I'd hoped to find a new home before the weather starts heating up as it gets pretty hot where I live.  Hopefully this lower price is good enough to bring some perspective buyers off the sidelines.  Let me know if you want pictures or have any questions.  My personal message box is wide open for you.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Asking price lowered to 0.02 BTC + shipping.

comments.author: jimjam123
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on April 30, 2023, 06:49:39 PMAsking price lowered to 0.02 BTC + shipping.Evening OG,My previous offer still stands.LMK

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: jimjam123 on May 02, 2023, 12:56:52 AMQuote from: OgNasty on April 30, 2023, 06:49:39 PMAsking price lowered to 0.02 BTC + shipping.Evening OG,My previous offer still stands.LMKI don’t believe you ever made an offer. You asked about low power mode and I let you know it is possible. If you want to grab it for 0.02 BTC and pay for shipping, it’s yours. Just shoot me a PM with your location and we’ll see what we can work out.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I’m still accepting offers for this piece of hardware. Feel free to contact me with any questions or offers. I am hoping to find a buyer willing to pay in bitcoins and avoid the typical auctions and marketplaces, but it’s starting to feel like I might need to go that route. If you are looking for an s17 then hit me up.

comments.author: ncsupanda
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on June 22, 2023, 09:28:43 PMI’m still accepting offers for this piece of hardware. Feel free to contact me with any questions or offers. I am hoping to find a buyer willing to pay in bitcoins and avoid the typical auctions and marketplaces, but it’s starting to feel like I might need to go that route. If you are looking for an s17 then hit me up. I've had great success via eBay auctions for this type of unit. With the normal protections in terms of serial recording / tracking etc.For some reason normal sales are stagnant, but auctions people go crazy.Good luck selling it.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: ncsupanda on June 23, 2023, 06:19:15 PMQuote from: OgNasty on June 22, 2023, 09:28:43 PMI’m still accepting offers for this piece of hardware. Feel free to contact me with any questions or offers. I am hoping to find a buyer willing to pay in bitcoins and avoid the typical auctions and marketplaces, but it’s starting to feel like I might need to go that route. If you are looking for an s17 then hit me up. I've had great success via eBay auctions for this type of unit. With the normal protections in terms of serial recording / tracking etc.For some reason normal sales are stagnant, but auctions people go crazy.Good luck selling it.I avoid eBay sales for this sort of thing just because I don’t trust PayPal and am not familiar enough with their new way of paying through bank accounts for me to feel comfortable doing it. Plus, this is being sold on behalf of NastyMining so I would much prefer to have the sale done in BTC to keep things simple. It is probably time for me to explore other avenues though, so I appreciate your suggestion.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I still have this. Would love for it to be supporting the network instead of collecting dust. I’m not exactly sure how much shipping would be for it, but I imagine it’s got to be worth something to someone. Especially now with prices starting to heat up. Looking for BTC only. Thanks for looking.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I am a bit surprised I haven’t received any offers for this. Do people think the price is too high? Feel free to shoot me a lowball offer. Would be nice to see what price makes this worth buying…Would anyone be interested if I put up a raffle with 16 spots at 0.001 BTC per spot? Then you might win it for $36.

comments.author: WhyFhy
comments.body: Quote from: OgNasty on November 17, 2023, 06:32:40 AMI am a bit surprised I haven’t received any offers for this. Do people think the price is too high? Feel free to shoot me a lowball offer. Would be nice to see what price makes this worth buying…Would anyone be interested if I put up a raffle with 16 spots at 0.001 BTC per spot? Then you might win it for $36.  I could use a garage heater , if we can't work something out I might would grab a couple tickets on this.

comments.author: jimjam123
comments.body: I will buy a few tickets.

comments.author: elokk
comments.body: what specific model is this? How many Th/s?

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: elokk on December 04, 2023, 03:56:28 PMwhat specific model is this? How many Th/s?Being totally honest I’m not 100% sure and would need to examine the unit to see if it says that information on it somewhere (which I could do if you’re really interested). I sent my S17Pro in for a repair and they sent me back this unit which I believe could be different. Anyway, it includes a printout showing it successfully mines at 56th/s.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Price dropped again. Negotiable if anyone is interested. I really just want to see this unit find a home that isn’t mine. I want to keep shipping inside the US to make things simple. I’m still open to a raffle too if you guys wanted to put up the BTC to make it happen.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: jwinterm on April 17, 2024, 12:37:15 PMOnly runs on 220V I guess? Correct. There are places that sell conversion kits for them if you wanted to try and run them on 110v, but the cost is pretty prohibitive so it would probably be cheaper and easier to just have an electrician install a 220v outlet for you to run this as is. The market is definitely in need of a high powered and competitive 110v miner option.
